Articles.Content:
Yes... a print version parts manual, schematics and all.

I would buy...

just sayin

There is always the parts-list in the wiki ;-0

I wouldn't buy a print version while KSP still isn't even in beta - we know Mk2 parts are incomplete, Mk3 parts are being replaced, etc. etc.

(And they are individual parts so what schematics would you want anyway?)
Parts quantity and stats are somewhat in flux. Even moreso with mods.

Still, maybe there's a good concept here; Maybe someone could make a quick reference, with quick info on all the parts? Or manuevers/quick information on planets or other things? A simple pdf document, perhaps?

It'd probably be a pain to update it, but someone might be willing to maintain it. If not, it could be a sort of crowdsourced document. Similar to the crowd-sourced science logs thing. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/56510-0-23-Crowd-sourced-Science-Logs-SCIENCE-NEEDS-YOU!

It'd be cool to just have a sheet with tips you can reference with things like "Remember the SAS" or "Don't go to space 1 hour after eating" (maybe not that last one)

Heck, i'd totally download something like that.

Again, it'd probably be a pain to maintain (ryhme not intended), but if it's crowd-sourced or something, it might not be so bad. As long as it doesn't end up a dead project.

So, like those Apollo manuals.

The ones based off of car manuals. I have one. But if you did this with KSP I'd buy it in a heartbeat.
I'd love to see those Apollo manuals, that'd be neat.
I can see this as being a desirable merchandise idea when the parts list is finalized. I'd also like a Kerbal solar system poster equivalent to this, but with the relevant planetary stats listed.

Still, maybe there's a good concept here; Maybe someone could make a quick reference, with quick info on all the parts? Or manuevers/quick information on planets or other things? A simple pdf document, perhaps?

...

What more would you want other than what's already on the wiki?

For parts check http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Parts. You can't go much more comprehensive. Size, weight, cost, thrust, ISP, everything. It even has links to more elaborate information.

For planets check http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Kerbol_System/Table. Again this page has everything important. Including links to more detailed information.

I think more games should come out with 'print' version of the rule set. When I say 'print' I really mean 'also used on Kindle'

Eve Online for example would make an interesting one although its a good point that rules do change.

...Again, it'd probably be a pain to maintain (ryhme not intended), but if it's crowd-sourced or something, it might not be so bad...

Like a wiki, in fact? Don't forget, if there's something you want on there YOU can create it!

(And not just you, but everyone else, so get working Tux and rdwulfe ^^).

Like a wiki, in fact? Don't forget, if there's something you want on there YOU can create it!

(And not just you, but everyone else, so get working Tux and rdwulfe ^^).

True, and just as you said that, I found something on the wiki that's basically exactly what I was talking about (but perhaps goes more in depth than I had imagined): http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Tutorial:Game_Manual

I guess it really does exist, if I had just spent the 10 seconds to google it.

True, and just as you said that, I found something on the wiki that's basically exactly what I was talking about (but perhaps goes more in depth than I had imagined): http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Tutorial:Game_Manual

I guess it really does exist, if I had just spent the 10 seconds to google it.

Good ho! Indulge yourself in the 100-odd pages of mine, too (link in signature).

What I was thinking of doing is creating a mission manifest. Once I have rockets prooven then have specs of each of the ships/rockets, price and 'to dos', then I will send it to congress

knowing me I will actually do none of that.
